intro: Carpophora viscosa var. kossinskyi, commonly known as the sticky carpophora, is a unique variant of the genus Carpophora. It is characterized by its viscid, sticky leaves that can trap small insects, contributing to its survival in arid environments. The plant belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. Its morphology features a trailing growth habit with tendrils that aid in climbing. This variant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and dry habitats.
